Sentencas: High level of mixed-conductivity and good stability of oxide La0.5Sr0.5FeO3-delta make it promising for the development of functional materials for such energy-related applications as solid oxide fuel cells and membrane reactors for partial oxidation of methane.
Titulo: Oxygen nonstoichiometry and defect equilibria in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-δ

Sentencas: The oxygen content in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-delta (x = 0, 0.25, 0.5) was measured by means of coulometric titration in the interval of partial oxygen pressure between 10(-20) and 0.5 atm at temperatures 750-950 degrees C.
Titulo: Oxygen nonstoichiometry and defect equilibria in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-δ

Sentencas: The obtained results were employed for defect structure analysis of oxides.
Titulo: Oxygen nonstoichiometry and defect equilibria in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-δ

Sentencas: An ideal solution model enabled satisfactory simulation of experimental data for barium-free oxide.
Titulo: Oxygen nonstoichiometry and defect equilibria in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-δ

Sentencas: A reasonable data description for barium-containing oxides was achieved in the model, assuming that some of the oxygen vacancies are unavailable for oxygen ions.
Titulo: Oxygen nonstoichiometry and defect equilibria in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-δ

Sentencas: Partial substitution of barium for strontium was found to decrease the oxidation reaction constant of iron ions, resulting in a raised concentration of n-type electronic charge carriers and a reduced concentration of p-type carriers.
Titulo: Oxygen nonstoichiometry and defect equilibria in La0.49Sr0.5-xBaxFeO3-δ
